# RandomWalker

> **Generate random walks of various types with tidyverse
> compatibility**

To view the full wiki, click here: [Full RandomWalker
Wiki](https://github.com/spsanderson/RandomWalker/blob/main/wiki/Home.md)

RandomWalker is a comprehensive R package that makes it easy to
generate, visualize, and analyze random walks. Whether you‚Äôre modeling
stock prices, simulating particle movements, or exploring stochastic
processes, RandomWalker provides a unified, tidyverse-compatible
interface with extensive distribution support.

## ‚ú® Key Features

- **üé≤ 27+ Distribution Types**: Generate random walks from Normal,
  Brownian Motion, Geometric Brownian Motion, Cauchy, Beta, Gamma,
  Poisson, and many more distributions
- **üìê Multi-Dimensional Support**: Create walks in 1D, 2D, or 3D space
- **üìä Rich Visualizations**: Built-in plotting functions with support
  for both static and interactive visualizations
- **üìà Statistical Analysis**: Comprehensive summary statistics
  including cumulative functions, confidence intervals, and distance
  metrics
- **üîß Tidyverse Compatible**: Works seamlessly with dplyr, tidyr, and
  ggplot2
- **‚ö° Easy to Use**: Sensible defaults with extensive customization
  options

## üì¶ Installation

Install the stable version from CRAN:

``` r
install.packages("RandomWalker")
```

Or get the development version from GitHub for the latest features and
bug fixes:

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("spsanderson/RandomWalker")
```

## üöÄ Quick Start

### Generate 30 Random Walks

The
[`rw30()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/rw30.md)
function provides a quick way to generate 30 random walks with 100 steps
each:

``` r
library(RandomWalker)

# Generate random walks
walks <- rw30()
head(walks, 10)
#> # A tibble: 10 √ó 3
#>    walk_number step_number      y
#>    <fct>             <int>  <dbl>
#>  1 1                     1  0    
#>  2 1                     2 -0.315
#>  3 1                     3  0.413
#>  4 1                     4 -0.351
#>  5 1                     5 -1.53 
#>  6 1                     6 -2.44 
#>  7 1                     7 -3.19 
#>  8 1                     8 -3.58 
#>  9 1                     9 -4.95 
#> 10 1                    10 -3.75
```

### Visualize Random Walks

Create beautiful visualizations with a single function call:

``` r
rw30() |>
  visualize_walks()
```

![Line plot showing 30 different random walk paths over time with
varying
trajectories](reference/figures/README-random_walk_visual_example-1.png)

### Summarize Statistics

Get comprehensive statistical summaries of your random walks:

``` r
# Overall summary
rw30() |>
  summarize_walks(.value = y)
#> # A tibble: 1 √ó 16
#>   fns   fns_name dimensions mean_val median range quantile_lo quantile_hi
#>   <chr> <chr>         <dbl>    <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>       <dbl>       <dbl>
#> 1 rw30  Rw30              1   -0.624 -0.900  49.1       -13.9        18.7
#> # ‚Ñπ 8 more variables: variance <dbl>, sd <dbl>, min_val <dbl>, max_val <dbl>,
#> #   harmonic_mean <dbl>, geometric_mean <dbl>, skewness <dbl>, kurtosis <dbl>

# Summary by walk
rw30() |>
  summarize_walks(.value = y, .group_var = walk_number) |>
  head(10)
#> # A tibble: 10 √ó 17
#>    walk_number fns   fns_name dimensions mean_val median range quantile_lo
#>    <fct>       <chr> <chr>         <dbl>    <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>       <dbl>
#>  1 1           rw30  Rw30              1    3.88   3.90  10.6       -0.636
#>  2 2           rw30  Rw30              1    0.848  0.922 10.4       -3.85 
#>  3 3           rw30  Rw30              1    3.32   3.09  10.2       -0.536
#>  4 4           rw30  Rw30              1   -3.40  -3.30  10.2       -7.30 
#>  5 5           rw30  Rw30              1    7.28   7.04  13.7        1.10 
#>  6 6           rw30  Rw30              1   -8.04  -9.73  19.2      -18.0  
#>  7 7           rw30  Rw30              1   -2.50  -2.56  11.3       -6.96 
#>  8 8           rw30  Rw30              1   -0.348 -0.426  7.21      -3.41 
#>  9 9           rw30  Rw30              1    7.19   5.56  16.2        1.44 
#> 10 10          rw30  Rw30              1    1.42   1.44  12.8       -4.34 
#> # ‚Ñπ 9 more variables: quantile_hi <dbl>, variance <dbl>, sd <dbl>,
#> #   min_val <dbl>, max_val <dbl>, harmonic_mean <dbl>, geometric_mean <dbl>,
#> #   skewness <dbl>, kurtosis <dbl>
```

## üéØ Common Use Cases

### 1. Custom Random Walks with Specific Distributions

``` r
# Normal walk with custom parameters
random_normal_walk(
  .num_walks = 5,
  .n = 50,
  .mu = 0,
  .sd = 0.1,
  .initial_value = 100
) |>
  visualize_walks()
```

![](reference/figures/README-custom_examples-1.png)

``` r

# Geometric Brownian Motion (great for stock prices!)
geometric_brownian_motion(
  .num_walks = 10,
  .n = 100,
  .mu = 0.05,
  .sigma = 0.2,
  .initial_value = 100
) |>
  visualize_walks()
```

![](reference/figures/README-custom_examples-2.png)

### 2. Multi-Dimensional Random Walks

``` r
# 2D random walk
random_normal_walk(.num_walks = 3, .n = 100, .dimensions = 2) |>
  head(10)
#> # A tibble: 10 √ó 14
#>    walk_number step_number        x       y cum_sum_x cum_prod_x cum_min_x
#>    <fct>             <int>    <dbl>   <dbl>     <dbl>      <dbl>     <dbl>
#>  1 1                     1  0.0268  -0.0711    0.0268          0    0.0268
#>  2 1                     2  0.0268   0.0582    0.0536          0    0.0268
#>  3 1                     3 -0.195   -0.0251   -0.141           0   -0.195 
#>  4 1                     4 -0.0504  -0.148    -0.192           0   -0.195 
#>  5 1                     5  0.00382  0.0865   -0.188           0   -0.195 
#>  6 1                     6  0.131    0.139    -0.0567          0   -0.195 
#>  7 1                     7  0.0420   0.0549   -0.0148          0   -0.195 
#>  8 1                     8  0.0384  -0.0772    0.0236          0   -0.195 
#>  9 1                     9 -0.258    0.149    -0.234           0   -0.258 
#> 10 1                    10 -0.195    0.144    -0.429           0   -0.258 
#> # ‚Ñπ 7 more variables: cum_max_x <dbl>, cum_mean_x <dbl>, cum_sum_y <dbl>,
#> #   cum_prod_y <dbl>, cum_min_y <dbl>, cum_max_y <dbl>, cum_mean_y <dbl>

# 3D random walk
random_normal_walk(.num_walks = 2, .n = 50, .dimensions = 3) |>
  head(10)
#> # A tibble: 10 √ó 20
#>    walk_number step_number       x        y       z cum_sum_x cum_prod_x
#>    <fct>             <int>   <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl>     <dbl>      <dbl>
#>  1 1                     1  0.190   0.147    0.0425     0.190          0
#>  2 1                     2 -0.0333 -0.0159   0.0287     0.157          0
#>  3 1                     3  0.124  -0.0312   0.0523     0.281          0
#>  4 1                     4 -0.0133 -0.00990 -0.0491     0.267          0
#>  5 1                     5  0.0863 -0.0759  -0.106      0.354          0
#>  6 1                     6 -0.0173 -0.0564   0.0971     0.336          0
#>  7 1                     7  0.0345 -0.0564  -0.0301     0.371          0
#>  8 1                     8  0.0345  0.222    0.108      0.405          0
#>  9 1                     9 -0.0566 -0.0325   0.0971     0.349          0
#> 10 1                    10  0.104   0.199    0.123      0.453          0
#> # ‚Ñπ 13 more variables: cum_min_x <dbl>, cum_max_x <dbl>, cum_mean_x <dbl>,
#> #   cum_sum_y <dbl>, cum_prod_y <dbl>, cum_min_y <dbl>, cum_max_y <dbl>,
#> #   cum_mean_y <dbl>, cum_sum_z <dbl>, cum_prod_z <dbl>, cum_min_z <dbl>,
#> #   cum_max_z <dbl>, cum_mean_z <dbl>
```

### 3. Discrete Random Walks

``` r
# Discrete walk with upper/lower bounds
discrete_walk(
  .num_walks = 5,
  .n = 100,
  .upper_bound = 1,
  .lower_bound = -1,
  .upper_probability = 0.55,
  .initial_value = 0
) |>
  visualize_walks()
```

![](reference/figures/README-discrete_examples-1.png)

## üìö Available Random Walk Types

RandomWalker supports a wide variety of random walk types:

### Continuous Distributions

- **Normal**:
  [`random_normal_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_normal_walk.md),
  [`random_normal_drift_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_normal_drift_walk.md)
- **Brownian Motion**:
  [`brownian_motion()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/brownian_motion.md),
  [`geometric_brownian_motion()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/geometric_brownian_motion.md)
- **Beta**:
  [`random_beta_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_beta_walk.md)
- **Cauchy**:
  [`random_cauchy_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_cauchy_walk.md)
- **Chi-Squared**:
  [`random_chisquared_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_chisquared_walk.md)
- **Exponential**:
  [`random_exponential_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_exponential_walk.md)
- **F-Distribution**:
  [`random_f_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_f_walk.md)
- **Gamma**:
  [`random_gamma_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_gamma_walk.md)
- **Log-Normal**:
  [`random_lognormal_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_lognormal_walk.md)
- **Logistic**:
  [`random_logistic_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_logistic_walk.md)
- **Student‚Äôs t**:
  [`random_t_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_t_walk.md)
- **Uniform**:
  [`random_uniform_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_uniform_walk.md)
- **Weibull**:
  [`random_weibull_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_weibull_walk.md)
- **And more!**

### Discrete Distributions

- **Binomial**:
  [`random_binomial_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_binomial_walk.md)
- **Discrete**:
  [`discrete_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/discrete_walk.md)
- **Geometric**:
  [`random_geometric_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_geometric_walk.md)
- **Hypergeometric**:
  [`random_hypergeometric_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_hypergeometric_walk.md)
- **Multinomial**:
  [`random_multinomial_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_multinomial_walk.md)
- **Negative Binomial**:
  [`random_negbinomial_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_negbinomial_walk.md)
- **Poisson**:
  [`random_poisson_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_poisson_walk.md)

### Custom Walks

- **Custom Displacement**:
  [`custom_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/custom_walk.md),
  [`random_displacement_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_displacement_walk.md)

## üõ†Ô∏è Key Functions

| Function | Description |
|----|----|
| [`rw30()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/rw30.md) | Quickly generate 30 random walks |
| [`visualize_walks()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/visualize_walks.md) | Create visualizations (static or interactive) |
| [`summarize_walks()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/summarize_walks.md) | Generate comprehensive statistics |
| [`subset_walks()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/subset_walks.md) | Subset walks by max/min values |
| [`euclidean_distance()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/euclidean_distance.md) | Calculate distances in multi-dimensional walks |
| [`confidence_interval()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/confidence_interval.md) | Compute confidence intervals |
| [`running_quantile()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/running_quantile.md) | Calculate running quantiles |

  Documentation](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/)

  [RandomWalker](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/)

  [NEWS.md](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/NEWS.md) for latest
  changes

like to change.

  `randomwalker` tag

``` r
citation("RandomWalker")
```

**Made with ‚ù§Ô∏è for the R community**

# Package index

## Automatic Random Walks

Functions that generate non-modifiable random walks

- [`rw30()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/rw30.md)
  : Generate Random Walks

## Generator Functions

Functions that generate modifiable random walks

### Custom Generating Functions

- [`custom_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/custom_walk.md)
  : Generate Multiple Custom Random Walks in Multiple Dimensions

### Continuous Generating Functions

- [`brownian_motion()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/brownian_motion.md)
  : Brownian Motion
- [`geometric_brownian_motion()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/geometric_brownian_motion.md)
  : Geometric Brownian Motion
- [`random_beta_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_beta_walk.md)
  : Generate Multiple Random Beta Walks in Multiple Dimensions
- [`random_cauchy_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_cauchy_walk.md)
  : Generate Multiple Random Cauchy Walks in Multiple Dimensions
- [`random_chisquared_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_chisquared_walk.md)
  : Generate Multiple Random Chi-Squared Walks in Multiple Dimensions
- [`random_exponential_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_exponential_walk.md)
  : Generate Multiple Random Exponential Walks in Multiple Dimensions
- [`random_f_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_f_walk.md)
  : Generate Multiple Random F Walks in Multiple Dimensions
- [`random_gamma_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_gamma_walk.md)
  : Generate Multiple Random Gamma Walks in Multiple Dimensions
- [`random_logistic_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_logistic_walk.md)
  : Generate Multiple Random Logistic Walks in Multiple Dimensions
- [`random_lognormal_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_lognormal_walk.md)
  : Generate Multiple Random Lognormal Walks in Multiple Dimensions
- [`random_normal_drift_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_normal_drift_walk.md)
  : Generate Multiple Random Walks with Drift
- [`random_normal_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_normal_walk.md)
  : Generate Multiple Random Normal Walks in Multiple Dimensions
- [`random_t_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_t_walk.md)
  : Generate Multiple Random t-Distributed Walks in Multiple Dimensions
- [`random_uniform_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_uniform_walk.md)
  : Generate Multiple Random Uniform Walks in Multiple Dimensions
- [`random_weibull_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_weibull_walk.md)
  : Generate Multiple Random Weibull Walks in Multiple Dimensions

### Discrete Generating Functions

- [`discrete_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/discrete_walk.md)
  : Discrete Sampled Walk
- [`random_binomial_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_binomial_walk.md)
  : Generate Multiple Random Binomial Walks in Multiple Dimensions
- [`random_displacement_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_displacement_walk.md)
  : Generate a Random Displacement Walk in 2D
- [`random_geometric_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_geometric_walk.md)
  : Generate Multiple Random Geometric Walks in Multiple Dimensions
- [`random_hypergeometric_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_hypergeometric_walk.md)
  : Generate Multiple Random Hypergeometric Walks in Multiple Dimensions
- [`random_multinomial_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_multinomial_walk.md)
  : Generate Multiple Random Multinomial Walks
- [`random_negbinomial_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_negbinomial_walk.md)
  : Generate Multiple Random Negative Binomial Walks
- [`random_poisson_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_poisson_walk.md)
  : Generate Multiple Random Poisson Walks
- [`random_smirnov_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_smirnov_walk.md)
  : Generate Multiple Random Smirnov Walks in Multiple Dimensions
- [`random_wilcoxon_sr_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_wilcoxon_sr_walk.md)
  : Generate Multiple Random Wilcoxon Signed-Rank Walks
- [`random_wilcox_walk()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/random_wilcox_walk.md)
  : Generate Multiple Random Wilcoxon Walks in Multiple Dimensions

## Visualization Functions

Functions that visualise random walks

- [`visualize_walks()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/visualize_walks.md)
  : Visualize Walks

## Vector Functions

Functions that generate random walks in vector form

- [`cgmean()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/cgmean.md)
  : Cumulative Geometric Mean
- [`chmean()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/chmean.md)
  : Cumulative Harmonic Mean
- [`ckurtosis()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/ckurtosis.md)
  : Cumulative Kurtosis
- [`cmean()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/cmean.md)
  : Cumulative Mean
- [`cmedian()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/cmedian.md)
  : Cumulative Median
- [`crange()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/crange.md)
  : Cumulative Range
- [`csd()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/csd.md) :
  Cumulative Standard Deviation
- [`cskewness()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/cskewness.md)
  : Cumulative Skewness
- [`cvar()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/cvar.md)
  : Cumulative Variance
- [`euclidean_distance()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/euclidean_distance.md)
  : Distance Calculations
- [`kurtosis_vec()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/kurtosis_vec.md)
  : Compute Kurtosis of a Vector
- [`rw_range()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/rw_range.md)
  : Range
- [`skewness_vec()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/skewness_vec.md)
  : Compute Skewness of a Vector

## Helpers / Utilities

Functions that help with random walks

- [`confidence_interval()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/confidence_interval.md)
  : Confidence Interval
- [`convert_snake_to_title_case()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/convert_snake_to_title_case.md)
  : Helper function to convert a snake_case string to Title Case
- [`generate_caption()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/generate_caption.md)
  : Helper function to generate a caption string based on provided
  attributes
- [`get_attributes()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/get_attributes.md)
  : Get Attributes
- [`rand_walk_column_names()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/rand_walk_column_names.md)
  : Get Column Names
- [`rand_walk_helper()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/rand_walk_helper.md)
  : Random Walk Helper
- [`running_quantile()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/running_quantile.md)
  : Running Quantile Calculation
- [`std_cum_max_augment()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/std_cum_max_augment.md)
  : Augment Cumulative Maximum
- [`std_cum_mean_augment()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/std_cum_mean_augment.md)
  : Augment Cumulative Sum
- [`std_cum_min_augment()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/std_cum_min_augment.md)
  : Augment Cumulative Minimum
- [`std_cum_prod_augment()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/std_cum_prod_augment.md)
  : Augment Cumulative Product
- [`std_cum_sum_augment()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/std_cum_sum_augment.md)
  : Augment Cumulative Sum
- [`subset_walks()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/subset_walks.md)
  : Subset Walks by Extreme Values

## Statistic and Summary Functions

Functions that summarise random walks

- [`summarize_walks()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/summarize_walks.md)
  [`summarise_walks()`](https://www.spsanderson.com/RandomWalker/reference/summarize_walks.md)
  : Summarize Walks Data
